Name: Draculord
Subtitle: Hypnotic Vampire
Effect/Description: Level Up: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Take one card and put it into your hand.

Name: Xyzax
Subtitle: Progenitor Lich
Effect/Description: Level Up: Choose two cards from the discard pile and put them into your hand.

Name: King Croak
Subtitle: Sultan of the Sewers
Effect/Description: Level Up: You may search the Room Deck or discard pile for an Advanced Monster Room. You may immediately build the room (over a room with a matching Treasure type).

Name: Robobo
Subtitle: Angry Golem
Effect/Description: Level Up: Each opponent must choose and destroy one Room in his or her dungeon.

Name: Cerebellus
Subtitle: Father Brain
Effect/Description: Level Up: You may draw three Spell cards, then discard a Spell card.

Name: Seducia
Subtitle: Sorceress of Sexiness
Effect/Description: Level Up: You may search through town or the Hero decks, choose one Hero, and put it at the entrance to your dungeon.

Name: Cleopatra
Subtitle: Mother of Mummies
Effect/Description: Level Up: You may search the Room Deck or discard pile for an Advanced Trap Room. You may immediately build the room (over a room with a matching Treasure type).

Name: Gorgona
Subtitle: Queen of Medusia
Effect/Description: Level Up: Choose a Hero in town. Immediately destroy that Hero and place it face-down in your scorekeeping area.

Name: Dark Altar
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: Destroy this Room: Choose one card from the discard pile and put it into your hand.

Name: Open Grave
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: Once per turn, If a Hero dies in this room, choose one Room card from the discard pile and put into your hand.

Name: Specter's Sanctum
Subtitle: Monster Room
Effect/Description: When you build this room, choose an opponent. That opponent discards a random Spell card.

Name: Succubus Spa
Subtitle: Monster Room
Effect/Description: Once per turn, If a Hero Dies in this room, choose an opponent. Take a random Room or Spell card from that opponent's hand.

Name: Dracolich Lair
Subtitle: Advanced Monster Room
Effect/Description: Once per turn, you may discard two Room cards to choose one Rom card from the discard pile and put it into your hand.

Name: Vampire Bordello
Subtitle: Advanced Monster Room
Effect/Description: Once per turn, If a Hero dies in this room you may heal one wound. (Flip over one of your wounds, adding its Soul value to your total.)

Name: Goblin Armory
Subtitle: Monster Room
Effect/Description: Monster Rooms adjacent to this room deal +1 damage.

Name: Golem Factory
Subtitle: Monster Room
Effect/Description: Once per turn, if a hero dies in this room, draw a Room card.

Name: Minotaur's Maze
Subtitle: Monster Room
Effect/Description: The first time a Hero enters this room, send it back to the previous room.

Name: Neanderthal Cave
Subtitle: Monster Room
Effect/Description: You cannot build an Advanced Room on Neanderthal Cave.

Name: Beast Menagerie
Subtitle: Advanced Monster Room
Effect/Description: Once per turn when you build another Monster room, draw a Room card.

Name: Monster's Ballroom
Subtitle: Advanced Monster Room
Effect/Description: This room's damage is equal to the number of Monster rooms in your dungeon.

Name: Brainsucker Hive
Subtitle: Monster Room
Effect/Description: Once per turn, if a Hero dies in this room, you may draw a Spell card.

Name: Dark Laboratory
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: When you build this room, draw two spell cards, then discard a Spell card.

Name: Haunted Library
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: At the beginning of your turn, you may draw from the Spell deck instead of the Room deck.

Name: Witch's Kitchen
Subtitle: Monster Room
Effect/Description: Once per turn, you may discard a Monster Room card to draw a Spell card.

Name: All-Seeing Eye
Subtitle: Advanced Trap Room
Effect/Description: Once per turn when an opponent plays a Spell card, you may discard a Spell card to cancel its effect.

Name: Liger's Den
Subtitle: Advanced Monster Room
Effect/Description: Once per turn when you play a Spell card, draw a Spell card.

Name: Bottomless Pit
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: Destroy this room: Kill a Hero in this room.

Name: Boulder Ramp
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: Destroy another room in your dungeon: Deal 5 damage to a hero in this room.

Name: Dizzygas Hallway
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: If the next room in your dungeon is a Trap room, it has +2 damage.

Name: Jackpot Stash
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: Destroy this room: Double the treasure value of your dungeon's Rooms until end of turn.

Name: Recycling Center
Subtitle: Advanced Trap Room
Effect/Description: When another room in your dungeon is destroyed, you may draw two Room cards.

Name: The Crushinator
Subtitle: Advanced Trap Room
Effect/Description: Destroy another room in your dungeon: Until end of turn, your Rooms have +2 damage. Revised: Once per turn, you may destroy another Room in your dungeon to give all your Rooms +2 until end of turn.

Name: Centipede Tunnel
Subtitle: Monster Room
Effect/Description: When you build this room, you may swap the placement of two Rooms in any one dungeon.

Name: Construction Zone
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: When you build this room, you may immediately build an additional Room.

Name: Dragon Hatchery
Subtitle: Monster Room
Effect/Description: (This room contains all four treasure types.)

Name: Mimic Vault
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: When you build this room, choose one ordinary Hero in town and place it on the entrance to your dungeon.

Name: Monstrous Monument
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: When you build this room, choose one Monster Room from the discard pile and put it in your hand.

Name: Torture Chamber
Subtitle: Trap Room
Effect/Description: Destroy this room: Choose an opponent. That opponent discards a random Room card.

Name: Zombie Prison
Subtitle: Monster Room
Effect/Description: Destroy this room: Choose a dead Hero in an opponent's scorekeeping area. Send it back to the entrance of that player's dungeon

Name: Annihilator
Effect/Description: Give one Trap Room +3 damage until end of turn.

Name: Assassin
Effect/Description: Choose a Hero in an opponent's dungeon. Give that Hero +3 Health until end of turn.

Name: Cave-In
Effect/Description: Destroy a room in your dungeon. Kill any Hero in that Room.

Name: Counterspell
Effect/Description: Choose a Spell card that has just been declared. Cancel the effects of that Spell card. (The canceled Spell card is sent to the discard pile.)

Name: Exhaustion
Effect/Description: Deal X damage to one Hero in your dungeon, where X is equal to the number of rooms in your dungeon.

Name: Fear
Effect/Description: Choose a Hero in any dungeon and send it back to town.

Name: Freeze
Effect/Description: Choose and deactivate one Room in any dungeon. (It has no damage, treasure, or abilities until end of turn.)

Name: Giant Size
Effect/Description: Give one Monster Room +3 damage until end of turn.

Name: Jeopardy
Effect/Description: All players must discard their hands, then draw one Spell card and two Room cards.

Name: Kobold Strike
Effect/Description: No rooms can be built this turn. Any face-down Room is returned to its owner's hand.

Name: Motivation
Effect/Description: If you have fewer Rooms than an opponent, you may build an extra room this turn. (You must declare this before any Rooms are revealed.)

Name: Princess in Peril
Effect/Description: Choose one Hero in town. Place it at the entrance to your dungeon.

Name: Soul Harvest
Effect/Description: Choose a face-down Hero in your scorekeeping area and remove it from the game. Draw two Spell cards.

Name: Teleportation
Effect/Description: Send a Hero in your dungeon back to the first room of your dungeon. (It continues to move through your dungeon this turn.)

Name: Trepidation
Effect/Description: Choose a player with at least two more Souls than you. No Hero enters that player's dungeon this turn. (Any Heroes remain at the entrance to that dungeon.)

Name: Zombie Attack
Effect/Description: Choose a dead Hero in an opponent's scorekeeping area. Send it back to the entrance of that player's dungeon. Until end of turn, it has +2 Health.

Name: Cleric
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Nick the Masher The young cleric was well-armed, and brave enough to take on the Dragon King himself. His credo: "I bash it with my mace."

Name: Cleric
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Pugi the Druidess A defender of the wilderness, she wields the power of Nature. Flowers blossom in her footsteps, and life grows anew.

Name: Cleric
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Acacia, Warrior of Light Acacia is a carefree soul who makes her own luck. A strong defender of good, she is undeterred by even the darkest dungeons.

Name: Cleric
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Charles the Young Charles has mother's permission to go adventuring, but he has to return before sundown.

Name: Cleric
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Delatorious, Angel of Light Created by the Goddess of Light to defend Arcadia, this kid angel never misses a shot with his enchanted crossbow.

Name: Cleric
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Romero, the Indigo Friar He is a dedicated man of the cloth who wants to see the world coated in blue. You might think he's depressed, but he's actually very, very happy.

Name: Fighter
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Boden the Pantless Boden's courage is matched only by his forgetfulness. The quest to find his misplaced armor continues!

Name: Fighter
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Jarek, Squire to the Lion Knights As a squire, Jarek loved nothing more than stories and legends. He had no idea that someday, he would become one.

Name: Fighter
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Fire's Breath, Heroine of Arcadia The scarlet-haired warrior woman known as Fire's Breath has pledged her deadly twin blades to the fight for liberty

Name: Fighter
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Samurai Tom Not truly a samurai, this masterless ronin seeks honor and glory.

Name: Fighter
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Johnny of the Evening Watch A humble member of the Evening Watch, whose band o'brothers is sworn to forsake family, take the grey, and clear dungeons.

Name: Fighter
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Crystol and A'lan of Gerd Bound by the unbreakable Ring of Gerd, these lovers became the most dangerous husband-wife team in the adventuring business.

Name: Mage
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Tieg and the Magic Bubble Armed with his trusty bubble, Tieg braves dangerous castles and dungeons in search of the musical instruments stolen from his people.

Name: Mage
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Brandork the Neverwrong Schooled in seven flavors of magic, Brandork follows the teachings of master Face, the Omniscient Celestial

Name: Mage
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Mitchell, the Judge He has wandered the planes, hopelessly lost... ever since his wife, Nikki, sent him to the store for diamond dust sugar.

Name: Mage
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Kalish Ninefingers The worst thief ever, Kalish lost a finger and his freedom in one night. Taught magic in prison by his sorcerous cellmate, he now kills evil with fire.

Name: Mage
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Dartteon, Elf Pyromancer Some elves just want to watch the world burn.

Name: Mage
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Koey, The Last Dragon Mage The survivor of Drakonia vowed to save the world from Kirax's reign with the power bestowed to him by the last emerald dragon.

Name: Thief
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Joman Chimm, Cutpurse From the twinkle in his eye, you might think he comes bearing gifts... until you check your empty pockets.

Name: Thief
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Lance Uppercut, Treasure Hunter With a bent blade and a clenched fist, he gathers shining treasures for the glory of the Keonish Empire.

Name: Thief
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Jesta the Rogue "Okay, so you take the big guy on the left with the axe, you've got the two little ones on the right with swords, and I'll take this dangerous-looking treasure chest with no lock over here..."

Name: Thief
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Kins Klauski, Mad Conquistador "It's hard for me to think about death, how insects and worms will eat me... I never think about death. I haven't even properly started to live yet."

Name: Thief
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Sir Digby Apple, Ace Detective He battles to keep the coffers filling, to keep his partners preening and to send a needless message of power to all of the unwilling.

Name: Thief
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: Jerome, Kung Fu Monkey A Visitor from a distant land, his hyperactive monkey studied martial arts under the legendar Sifu Wang.

Name: The Fool
Subtitle: Ordinary Hero
Effect/Description: The Fool is lured to the dungeon of the Boss Monster with the fewest Souls. (In the case of a tie, he waits in town until the tie is broken.)

Name: Cleric
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Katelyn, Angelic Healer Among the most exalted defenders of righteousness, Katelyn is sometimes referred to as "altissima luce" -- highest light.

Name: Cleric
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Kerberos Dirtbeard, Canine Cleric Hailing from the Highlands, this flea-bitten friar never turns down a fetch quest.

Name: Cleric
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Lord Van Ette A prophet and collector of tithes for the omniscient Celestial, his "miracles" are enhanced by the brandewijn distilled by the monks of Nintehn.

Name: Cleric
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Jejune & Everlea, Holy SistersTenacious and vivacious, each is a threat on her own. But woe betide any who stand against the sisters' united power.

Name: Fighter
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Frankov, the Envoy This brave warrior stands alone against the evil that rules the world.

Name: Fighter
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Nate the Squidslayer This surly warrior defeated the mighty Squib, Lord of the Rocktopi. Now he seeks to destroy King Croak himself...

Name: Fighter
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Antonius, the Rune Knight An elite dragoon, Sir Tony wears armor inscribed with magic runes of ancient and mysterious power.

Name: Fighter
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Asmor the Aweless What Asmor lacks in tactical acuity, he more than makes up for in impulsiveness. There's no door he won't kick down, much to the frustration of Arcadia's innkeepers.

Name: Mage
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Tempros the Time Marauder He would use his control over time to end all crime. In his hands, this world could be a utopia.

Name: Mage
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Chia Kang, Mystical Warlock of Yu "Hey, Listen! I think this Boss Monster is--" "Silence, fairy! I will crush him through fire and flames in the name of the Order!

Name: Mage
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Terric Warhelm, Half-Elf Archmage "Weakened by an evil curse, this once-mighty warrior donned the red robes and turned to magic. His spells are chnneled through a magical helmet of untold power."

Name: Mage
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Wayward, the Drifter He is a traveler from a strange land whose only goal is to do whatever is right... whatever that means.

Name: Thief
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Hya, Legendary Shinobi Arcadia's deadliest ninja,Hya lives by the proverb that revenge is a dish best served cold.

Name: Thief
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Blackbeard Jake He hid the treasure he won from insult swordfighting in a booty-trap filled cave on the coast of a town called Astoria.

Name: Thief
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Cecil Leoran, Master Factotum The ultimate jack-of-all-trades, Cecil isn't above taking mercenary work to earn gold and glory. But his real goal has never changed: to find a way to return his betrothed Nevra, sealed into a rapier, to her original form.

Name: Thief
Subtitle: Epic Hero
Effect/Description: Wallbanger Basketweaver This humble halfing world rather spend his days weaving baskets and eating crumbly cookies. But when adventure calls, he proves a first-rate burglar
